Subject: NEVER AGAIN!
Message:
View this post on the web at https://msmeafrica.substack.com/p/never-again

Dear entrepreneurs,
I started sharing a story last week and I'll give the rest of the story today.  It was more like that essay we were asked to write in Secondary School about “The Day I will never forget!”
Thanks for reading MSME Africa Pulse! Subscribe for free to receive new posts and support my work.
Mine was about how I went to a restaurant and ordered food without checking the menu, particularly the prices!
So what did I do to save my face?
Guys!!! If there's anything you must have in life, have rich friends!
Thank God I did. Cos what would I have done?
So, after I finished eating, I saw the bill and my heart skipped a beat. My body temperature rose immediately too. It wasn't even funny at all.
 For those of you who thought I would have washed the plates at that restaurant to make up for the money I owed. I'm sorry to disappoint you!😂🤣
I called a friend and explained my plight and she transferred the money to my account immediately. 
That was how my God did not shame me. That is the end of my story.
My advice to you all is to check your account balance before going anywhere so that you won't find yourself in a situation similar to mine.
Here’s what I have for you this week:
Trending Business News 
Opportunities Galore
Entrepreneurial Origins
Fun Facts about Entrepreneurship 
Trending Business News
The African Development Bank (AfDB) has announced that 30 Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) from Côte d’Ivoire, Ghana, and Rwanda have been selected to receive financing and technical assistance through the AfriCircular Innovators Programme. 1,000 Edo Women Receive N50 Million Business Grant From Nigerian First Lady through Renewed Hope Initiative
Nigeria’s First Lady, Senator Oluremi Tinubu, has provided a business grant of N50 million to 1,000 women in Edo State. The initiative, under her Hope Initiative (RHI), is part of a broader nationwide program to support 37,000 women across all 36 states and the Federal Capital Territory. United Bank for Africa (UBA) Plc is set to host another edition of its Business Series, reinforcing its dedication to the growth and sustainability of Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) across Africa. The Farmers for the Future (F4F) initiative, aimed at empowering young entrepreneurs in the agricultural sector, has announced a new opportunity for National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) members to apply for grants of up to ₦10 million. Pastor Folu Adeboye Launches Tech Training Program for 76,000 African Women
Pastor (Mrs) Folu Adeboye, wife of the General Overseer of the Redeemed Christian Church of God, has unveiled the Ladies in Tech Africa Program to bridge the gender gap in Africa’s tech industry. This initiative aims to provide free, three-month tech training for 76,000 women across Africa. READ MORE [ https://substack.com/redirect/08660af8-cc57-485a-9068-5cabd66ca45b?j=eyJ1IjoiM2d5ZzliIn0.alnGDomjVT_QLyk6rHfohzJ76Mnc2-lH01FZb1ohFiM ] 
SUKHIBA Secures $1.55M Seed Extension to Expand Conversational Commerce Platform Across Emerging Markets
SUKHIBA, a pioneering conversational commerce and CRM platform, has completed a $1.55 million seed extension round, spearheaded by EQ2 Ventures. READ MORE  [ https://substack.com/redirect/33a909c4-a100-4b60-8195-0f155a98c3c7?j=eyJ1IjoiM2d5ZzliIn0.alnGDomjVT_QLyk6rHfohzJ76Mnc2-lH01FZb1ohFiM ]
Nigerian Government Appoints 23 Fund Managers for the $10 Billion Nigeria Global Investment Fund (NGIF)
The Federal Government of Nigeria has appointed 23 fund managers to oversee the $10 billion Nigeria Global Investment Fund (NGIF). This ambitious initiative is designed to draw international and local capital into key sectors of Nigeria’s economy, including agriculture, manufacturing, energy, infrastructure, and fintech. Entrepreneurial Origins 
Last Week's Trivia
In what year was Jumia, Africa's largest e-commerce platform, founded?
A) 2010
B) 2012
C) 2015
D) 2018
The right answer is B) 2012
Fun Facts about Entrepreneurship 
Did you know that some of the world's most successful companies were started in garages?
- Apple was started in Steve Jobs' parents' garage in 1976.
- Amazon was started in Jeff Bezos' garage in 1994.
- Google was started in Larry Page and Sergey Brin's garage in 1998.
- Disney was started in Walt Disney's garage in 1920.
- Harley-Davidson was started in William Harley and Arthur Davidson's garage in 1903.
These entrepreneurs turned their garage startups into global brands, proving that great ideas can start small and grow into something amazing!

Subject: Connecting with your audience over the camera is a science and an art
Message:
Tips for showing up on camera + new giveaway winner  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 

Hey Enoch,

Are you hesitant to go all-in on YouTube because you're uncomfortable on camera?

Are you keeping parts of your personality hidden while recording your videos because you feel a little shy?

It doesn't have to be that way. 

You can have full confidence to press record! Here's how you can build up some courage for the next time you're getting ready to record (or to finally START, if you haven't yet!)

**Get your reps in**
The only way to get better is with practice. Get through your whole recording even if you have to fumble your way through. The more times you talk in front of the camera, the more natural it'll start to feel.

**Embrace being imperfect**
After all these years, I still make mistakes. I have to do several takes of the same line if it doesn't come out quite right. It's totally ok if you mess up a few times. Just keep it movin' 

**Know your subject matter**
Get yourself prepared ahead of time. When you know your stuff in theory, you're more likely to conjure up a little more confidence 

**Tip: When first starting out, it might help to outline what you plan to say. Then you can pick off where things got a little shaky and keep rolling on through.**

**Don't focus on your insecurity**
We all have something we're a little uncomfortable about. Whether it's something to do with our physical appearance, or the way we talk, or something we think other people will notice. Don't apologize for it on camera and bring attention to it - chances are that nobody even notices.

 

**Giveaway Winner Announcement** 

We've been running an ongoing giveaway competition and we've announced a few winners so far. Those lucky winners have taken home awesome prizes like audio gear to upgrade their videos and software to make their video production more seamless.

This week, our newest winner is 

**Brittney Jeffers** from Glassboro, NJ, USA! You've just won for yourself a Samson Technologies Dynamic Mic! To claim your prize, contact us at thinkmediasupport.com https://seancannell.acemlnb.com/lt.php?x=3DZy~GDDKaKa5sKuzw1MguFu~3Apjd-gwhhlYXnKJXib7pN-yEy.0ONt237zitD2kfYwbHLMJFSa to let the team know you're a giveaway winner.

Subject: 🚨 Don’t fall for recruitment scams! Here’s how to stay safe with Jiji 🛡️
Message:
Hello there! 👋


We hope you’re staying safe and thriving! 💚 We’re
                              reaching out today to help you keep your experience with online transactions smooth and
                              scam-free!


What's going on?
We recently noticed some sneaky individuals creating fake recruitment groups on
                              platforms like Telegram and WhatsApp. They pretend to be Jiji and illegally use our brand
                              identity to deceive unsuspecting individuals. Our goal is to ensure you can smell them
                              from afar and protect yourself from falling victim.


How to stay safe
At Jiji, we ONLY advertise job opportunities through our official website, verified social
                              media accounts, and authorised recruitment partners. If it’s not on one of these channels,
                              it’s not from us!


🧠 Know our verified channels
🔐 Keep your information safe
Never share your personal or financial information with anyone. If you come across an
                              unverified group or page (without verification ticks), please inform our support team at
                              support@jiji.ng 


🙅 Avoid making payments for a job offer
Jiji will never ask you to pay a fee to be considered
                              for a job. Stay alert and don’t fall for these fraudsters!


Been scammed? Here’s what to do:
Report the incident to the Police or EFCC with all the details. They can help track down
                              the culprit and take action.


❗️Remember that all our official pages are verified
                              and have a tick next to their names. If you see a page without a tick, it’s not us.


Have any questions or need assistance? Reach out to us
                              at support@jiji.ng or via our verified social media channels.


Have a safe day! 💚
Jiji Guard

A key ingredient to success that everyone forgets  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 

Hey Enoch,

A lot of the mega successful YouTubers you see 

**didn't** achieve their level of success 

**just** on their own. They had the right people with the right skills in their corner. 

Even the Think Media brand has

**A WHOLE TEAM** of hardworking creatives behind it.

Sure, it takes your VISION, your CREATIVITY, and your PASSION to get things 

**started** but it always takes the support of another person to help keep you 

**going**. Whether that's your spouse, your best friend, a coach, or another YouTuber that you admire.

The thing is, we all NEED human connection and support, no matter how introverted you might think you are. 

**Especially** as content creators-the road can get pretty lonely.

That's why the right networking event is so crucial for helping you to RECHARGE and GROW.

Here are some of the benefits of networking with other creatives:

**1. Meet people to partner with**
While you're investing in your YouTube gear and education, have you thought about investing in your 

**SOCIAL CAPITAL**? It's not only about 

**WHAT** you know but 

**WHO** you know. Your next golden collab or partnership could be waiting to happen at the next conference you attend.

**2. Learn from experts in the field**
Networking is a great way to get in the same room with the masterminds from your industry so that you can have a meaningful conversation with them about growing your 

**own** brand. 

**3. Connect with your peers about industry trends**
Hearing from other creators about what's NOT working for them could help you to fine-tune your own strategy and 

**save time**. Networking shows you how to build momentum, scale up your business, and stay relevant.

4. Get ideas

Ever had a crazy creative idea pop up in your mind while taking a shower? Those ideas don't come 

**out of thin air**. They come from insightful conversations or something inspiring that you saw. Ideas take time to cook in your 

**subconsciousness**. Networking events are great opportunities for several seeds of greatness to be planted in your mind!

**5. Have fun!**
I don't need to convince you that you need to have fun on this creator journey! Give yourself permission to relax and have a good time once in a while! You need a balance of work and play to maximize your productivity.

Enoch, the big picture here is that we need people 

**behind** us, 

**beside** us, and 

**in front** of us if we're going to see 

**true success on YouTube.**

When you go to your next networking event, here's how you can get the MOST benefit:

Don't be shy!
Show up with purpose
Clean up your social media to reflect where you are with your brand
Take your own business cards and collect contacts from others
Take lots of notes
Follow up with the people you meet when you get home

Keep these tips in mind for the next time you're getting ready for a networking event.

**P.S**. Use the code "

**NETWORKING**" on the giveaway form here https://seancannell.acemlnb.com/lt.php?x=3DZy~GDDKaKa5sKuzw1MguFu~3Apjd-gwhhlYXnKJXib7pN-yEy.0ONt2HVzitD0j_YwbHLMJXia to be one of the lucky winners to walk away with free software subscription, a brand new mic, lighting gear, or an awesome Sony camera! You don't know which email might have the next hidden code so keep opening and reading them to increase your chances of winning an awesome prize

Subject: DON'T TRY IT!
Message:
View this post on the web at https://msmeafrica.substack.com/p/dont-try-it

Dear entrepreneurs,
Let me give you a gist, You people should not make jest of me oh!
Thanks for reading MSME Africa Pulse! Subscribe for free to receive new posts and support my work.
On a fateful Tuesday morning, I woke up very hungry and I didn't feel like cooking, So I decided to give myself a treat. I entered a new restaurant around my area and ordered a plate of Amala and Ogufe. You know I'll do anything for swallow.
I didn't even ask how much it was, I just started eating immediately because I was very hungry. 
Do you know what?
I finished eating and they brought the bill. Guys!!! I saw #15,000. I thought my eyes were playing tricks on me at first so I asked the waiter how much it was. That was when I knew I was in trouble. 
I had assumed that it won't be up to N5000 and that was the exact amount left in my account. 
The only thoughts in my head was how I would leave this place unscathed?
I should have known when I saw the ambiance of this place. How on earth could I have thought I was enjoying the A.C. for nothing.? How did I get out of this mess? Watch out for the rest of the story next week.
Here’s what I have for you this week:

Federal Government Delays N150 Billion Loan Disbursement for MSMEs and Manufacturers to September
The Nigerian Federal Government has postponed the start of the N150 billion loan disbursement for manufacturers and micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) to September. This announcement was made by the Minister of Industry, Trade, and Investment, Dr. Doris Uzoka-Anite, during a meeting with beneficiaries of the Presidential Grant and prospective recipients of the MSME Presidential Loan in Calabar, Cross River State. The notice warned that non-compliance would result in the sealing off of business premises. Subject: New Options to Manage Personalization on Google Play
Message:
Hello Enoch,

In the coming weeks, Google Play will launch new personalization options  
that give you more seamless control of your personalization preferences and  
allow you to better manage your data in Play.

Personalization provides a richer experience in the Play store, helping you  
discover exciting games, useful apps, relevant offers and much more, all of  
which is tailored to you. Learn more about personalizing your Google Play  
Store experience  
<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/ANiao5qv4dLC2Q4yZNPDKuQUbmrugYlNO5Q64sUJRLg55XrM-OT1q97YM9Mc7As9eO9fSpAy5D_odbJ_LLSLuW1Kq00Pqi1D-08eVfeViU6bgMIXv-f6B2Uo3hVUXO2Oa58gOPXnIlvR2WNVhn8czpyaDSWfl0X6UfR-jV_5BX_fsEV1psi_LYAoVOm0RvUocZNU43hHHlH-Ed3VRTdNkhqYG-gy-1x8ablIglg42Y_taC73YgqgU_JB8hFDY5rmCd0HdC8pwax4M7yFQi3yiCTNr6jZaK1yMf0Pi4Sq6S0AysFMUiP_UCcq4gxtFv5oDTtEQhuSQ_3QiA>

Once available, these new features - alongside existing Play  
personalization controls - will be easily accessible by visiting  
Personalization in Play from the Google Play Store menu. This new  
destination will be a one-stop-shop for tailoring your personalization  
preferences in Play, giving you a more powerful way to:

• Manage all of your personalization options on Google Play and easily view  
activity and access personalization controls

• Choose which apps, books or other library items are used to personalize  
your Google Play experience. With one click you will be able to exclude use  
of Play data associated with that app for personalization in Play. Some  
examples of data that would be excluded for that app would include when you  
install or uninstall it, purchases that you make in it and your app  
activity. Learn more about new personalization options  
<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/ANiao5qLGg0J6MdDllKBT-YoS3xSKZC_zfTpn7kGEEYDThT8qATHLcjDbU3NhkVr6jash3xb3f1WhmsHfcMi5tyPT6Ge_DHSmPbH5l-51z3fyknwjLBvCv9Spx98XzLUzGroGBprQO1cjoEc32VJesCpmwyB9KG-PUEIVf-GLxYmShuzoRsdmRbUoZ2zhmJF0hfNT0c4IW0m7sA0MbNTAwKZPuzF15Giy3QDeEFve6jCyiKnS67BvRJq-ZD--3L9gSeWcGBfXgoVZArybwXoIvU6ijhVpAz35P8CzkBKsv1IseE5BRo>

With these enhanced controls you can ensure that you have a better Play

Subject: Failed production deployment
Failed production deployment
The one thing missing from your YouTube strategy
Message:
YouTube's golden rule...  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 

Hey Enoch,

What if you follow all the "right steps" when posting your YouTube video, but you're still not getting any views?

Interesting video title? Check ✅
Click-worthy thumbnail? Check ✅

You post your video and then wait...

Crickets.

You might be wondering "

**What am I doing wrong?!**" You may even fear you're being shadow-banned by the algorithm.

I know it can be frustrating putting in all that time and hard work into making a single video only for it to get lost in the millions of other videos that are uploaded to YouTube.

That's why I'm reminding you about 

**YouTube's golden rule.**

You might be tempted to think that the golden rule is to please the YouTube algorithm.
Lots of creators think pleasing the algorithm is a mysterious code to crack. Don't think of it like it's an abstract concept that only a few creators have the secret formula for. If there's any secret, it would be this: 

**replace the word "ALGORITHM" with "AUDIENCE.**" 

Your content planning strategy should always include how you're going to meet your audience's needs:

Are you going to provide knowledge?

A new insight?

Escape from reality?

Relief from boredom?

A good laugh?

Answers about their health concerns?

Entertainment?

Remember, needs are different and one video can meet several needs all at once.

When you make your videos, try to serve your audience first, NOT the algorithm. That's it. That's YouTube's golden rule. 

Hear me out.

YouTube's main objective has always been to keep people on the platform for as long as possible. If your videos keep viewers glued to YouTube, you can safely bet it's going to keep suggesting your videos to others with similar interests. 

It's just like the example I gave in a previous email. If a librarian knows that a particular book always meets peoples' needs and leaves them satisfied, they're going to keep recommending the book to others.

There are a couple ways that YouTube measures how satisfied a viewer is with your content. They use metrics like your video's click-through rate and average view duration to determine if your content is meeting your audience's needs.

If YouTube thinks you're not serving your audience, it can start to feel like you're being shadow-banned. In this video, https://seancannell.acemlnb.com/lt.php?x=3DZy~GDDKaKa5sKuzw1MguFu~3Apjd-gwhhlYXnKJXib7pN-yEy.0ONt2XzzitD0jNYwbHLMJXid I explain how your views can tank if you're not playing by YouTube's rules, especially the golden one.

Make sure to check it out!

https://seancannell.acemlnb.com/lt.php?x=3DZy~GDDKaKa5sKuzw1MguFu~3Apjd-gwhhlYXnKJXib7pN-yEy.0ONt2XzzitD0jNYwbHLMJXid 

Watch the video here https://seancannell.acemlnb.com/lt.php?x=3DZy~GDDKaKa5sKuzw1MguFu~3Apjd-gwhhlYXnKJXib7pN-yEy.0ONt2XzzitD0jNYwbHLMJXid

Subject: How to script a video
Message:
to get people to watch the whole thing  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 

Hey Enoch,

Here's something you probably already know: people are 

**judgmental**. 

They take 30 seconds to size you up.

**30 seconds.**

That's how long it takes someone to decide if they want to continue watching your YouTube video. It's getting harder and harder to get and hold people's attention nowadays because there are so many...options.

How do you increase your Average View Duration (AVD) so that you can hit 4,000 watch hours quicker and so that all your hard work doesn't go to waste?

How do you hook people and draw them in to watch the rest of your video instead of hopping off to the next shiny object?

How do you keep them interested in what you have to say?

The answer, my friend, is in crafting the right script.

When I say "script," I don't necessarily mean writing out exactly what you're going to say word-for-word (more on that later!). Your script is your general framework. Your guide. Your verbal and even visual map of the journey you want to take your viewers on.

Since people take an average of 30 seconds to decide whether or not they want to jump ship, you need to spend some time thinking about and crafting your 

**hook**. 

The hook is the first thing viewers hear and see as soon as your video starts. People need to feel as though you're about to deliver on the promise you made in your title and thumbnail and 

**NOT** like you're about to waste their time. 

You can spice up your hook by appealing to their core desires. Think about what your audience really wants. 

Do they want to 

**feel more confident** about their bodies?

Do they want to be 

**entertained**?

Do they want to feel 

**empowered** and 

**educated** enough to make a big decision?

Craft your hook to reassure them that they're in the right place.

Another way to strengthen your hook is by using a 

**tease** to create curiosity. That's a preview of what's coming up later in the video or footage of a desired result. For example, you could use a couple seconds of a clip that's in the middle of your video and cut it just before you get to the juicy details.

Another technique that you can use to really hook a viewer is by 

**showing and telling**.

What do I mean? Here's an example:

Suppose you have a channel about fitness. While you're talking about your body transformation, show footage or pictures of yourself before and after your transformation. Show clips of yourself working out and meal prepping. 

**Tell** viewers what you did and give 

**visuals** of how you did it.

"Now, how do I keep viewers from hopping off my vid, Sean?"

I gotcha.

Scripting is also a way to keep you on track while recording your video. If you veer off topic, that's when you're more likely to lose your audience's attention.

Using bullet points or writing out exactly what you want to say word-for-word in a style that sounds like your natural speaking voice not only helps you to express your thoughts fully without forgetting details, but it also helps to keep your viewer interested and engaged.

Nolan goes into so much more detail about the scripting process and gives more examples in this video https://seancannell.acemlnb.com/lt.php?x=3DZy~GDDKaKa5sKuzw1MguFu~3Apjd-gwhhlYXnKJXib7pN-yEy.0ONt13VzitDzjNYwbHLMJXGh.

Be sure to check it out!

Let's crush,

https://seancannell.acemlnb.com/lt.php?x=3DZy~GDDKaKa5sKuzw1MguFu~3Apjd-gwhhlYXnKJXib7pN-yEy.0ONt13VzitDzjNYwbHLMJXGh

Subject: It’s Premier League Season!
Message:
View this post on the web at https://msmeafrica.substack.com/p/its-premier-league-season

Dear Entrepreneur,
The Premier League season is here, and the excitement is palpable! But I'm not just talking about football...
Thanks for reading MSME Africa Pulse! Subscribe for free to receive new posts and support my work.
As a business owner, are you ready to score big in the marketplace? Do you have a winning strategy in place to outshine the competition and drive success?
Take a minute to reflect:
- What are your goals for this season?
- Are you leveraging the right marketing channels?
- How will you capitalize on the Premier League frenzy?
Take a step back, identify your ideal customers, and speak directly to them. Understand their pain points and preferences.
Are you setting targets or just winging it?
Pick a channel that works for you: social media, email, SEO, traditional (print, radio, TV), or experiential (events, sponsorships). Remember, mixing channels creates magic!
Think of it like jollof rice - combine ingredients, add flavor, and serve hot!
Always embrace a culture of experimentation and learning. 
Thank you  to everyone who has filled our survey. But we won't mind getting more responses! Subject: Enoch, here's how to improve your videos
Message:
Keep your viewer glued and hooked  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 

I'm gonna be real with you, Enoch. Very few people are going to sit and watch all of your 20-minute video UNLESS you're dropping the cure to cancer or your personality draws in the viewer.

Even then, the vast majority of viewers drop off after the first 

**30 seconds**. People's attention span is just too short these days. So, you have to find ways to keep them engaged.

There are things you can do to add some 

**SPICE** to your videos with graphics and animations. Here are a few:

First up, let's talk about 

**text overlays**. These are your best friend when you want to highlight key points or add extra info without having to say it out loud. Plus, they're perfect for those moments when you're trying to be witty and need that little extra oomph.

Next, consider using 

**infographics**. These are golden for channels that dive into data or complex topics. They break down information into bite-sized, visually appealing chunks that your audience can easily digest.

**Transitions and animations** are also a game-changer. Ever watched a video where scenes just awkwardly cut from one to the next? Yeah, let's avoid that. Smooth transitions keep the flow going and animations can add that extra bit of flair. This simple little trick can take your video up a notch from ordinary to extraordinary!

For those of you into tutorials or tech reviews, 

**screen recordings and screencasts** are a must. Show, don't just tell! Whether you're demonstrating software, gaming, or navigating a website, this visual aid is essential especially if you add a voiceover.

And let's not forget about 

**B-roll footage**. These are your cutaway shots that correspond to what you're talking about at the moment. You can film these yourself or use stock footage. They add context, depth, and keep the visuals fresh. Whether it's scenic shots, close-ups, or even memes, B-roll can make your video feel more dynamic.

A little sprinkle of graphics here, a dash of animation there, and you'll have more of your viewers watching all the way to the end of your video (that's what YouTube wants and that's what you definitely want!).

Keep experimenting with a unique style that suits you and have fun while you're at it!

Subject: Are you comfortable being yourself?
Message:
View this post on the web at https://msmeafrica.substack.com/p/are-you-comfortable-being-yourself

Dear Entrepreneur,
Many of us think branding is just giving your business a unique look and personality. It’s not just that!
Thanks for reading MSME Africa Pulse! Subscribe for free to receive new posts and support my work.
You want to stand out from other businesses, right? Strong branding is how you do that.
Asides your logo, and colors, the way you talk to people is part of branding too. It's important to know what your business stands for.  Once you know this, you can make sure everything about your business matches. This includes your social media, website, and all your advertising.
However, one major thing many miss out on is that  emotional connection and authenticity that differentiates you from the crowd. Be authentic!
Strive to create a deep bond with your customers, and be unique! Building a strong brand takes time and effort, but it's worth it. I can tell you that for free.
An authentic brand can make your business more valuable, and keep customers coming back. Be comfortable in your own skin and your business will thank you for it.
If you have not responded to this survey, please do so NOW.
Share Your Voice!
Your thoughts matter! We want to hear from you!
Your feedback will directly impact our content, ensuring it resonates with you and meets your needs. Please help fill this survey. 
It won't take you 2 minutes!
Thank you for your valuable input!
Here’s what I have for you this week :
Trending Business News 
Feature Articles 
Opportunities Galore
Entrepreneurial Origins
Fun Facts about Entrepreneurship In Africa 
Trending News
KSH Foundation Launches Her-Startup Initiative to Empower Female Entrepreneurs Across Africa
The Khalil Suleiman Halilu (KSH) Foundation, in partnership with Tomorrow Foundation and EHA Impact Ventures, has launched a new initiative, “Her-Startup,” aimed at empowering female entrepreneurs across Africa to drive economic growth on the continent. READ MORE  [ https://substack.com/redirect/bf5e126f-c026-4363-8c01-0d6b69ee4c0a?j=eyJ1IjoiM2d5ZzliIn0.alnGDomjVT_QLyk6rHfohzJ76Mnc2-lH01FZb1ohFiM ]
75,000 Nigerians Set to Receive N1 Million Each in Micro and Small Business Loans at Single-Digit Interest Rates, President Tinubu Announces.
In response to nationwide protests over hunger and governance issues, President Bola Tinubu has announced significant economic measures to support Nigerian businesses and create jobs. During a national broadcast, he revealed that 75,000 Nigerians are set to receive N1 million each in micro and small business loans at single-digit interest rates starting in August 2024. READ MORE [ https://substack.com/redirect/d70001da-9094-4d1c-aac3-f7b37f888c67?j=eyJ1IjoiM2d5ZzliIn0.alnGDomjVT_QLyk6rHfohzJ76Mnc2-lH01FZb1ohFiM ]
Meristem Nigeria Unveils MORE – a free-to-use youth-focused Investment and Entrepreneurship Learning Platform
Meristem Orientation for Rising Entrepreneurs (MORE) – is a free-to-use youth-focused investment and entrepreneurship learning platform. They are empowering the dreams of young and ambitious people by giving them access to information, knowledge, and skills that they require to bring them closer to where they want to be financially. READ MORE [ https://substack.com/redirect/c2bc1ee1-9997-40c8-bc08-df5fd9c692a7?j=eyJ1IjoiM2d5ZzliIn0.alnGDomjVT_QLyk6rHfohzJ76Mnc2-lH01FZb1ohFiM ] 
SmallSmall Announces Collaboration with Herconomy and Others to Empower Female Entrepreneurs at SmallSmall Fair 2024
SmallSmall, a prominent advocate for financial literacy and installment payment plans, has announced a strategic collaboration with Herconomy, FezDelivery, CargoPlug, and MoneyAfrica to support female entrepreneurs at the upcoming SmallSmall Fair 2024. READ MORE  [ https://substack.com/redirect/526670be-f7f2-44ac-bbb1-7001600fba52?j=eyJ1IjoiM2d5ZzliIn0.alnGDomjVT_QLyk6rHfohzJ76Mnc2-lH01FZb1ohFiM ]
Nigerian Government Releases N570 Billion in Grants to Combat Economic Hardship and Hunger
The Nigerian Federal Government has announced the release of ₦570 billion in grants to all 36 states to tackle economic hardship and hunger. In a national address on August 4, 2024, President Bola Tinubu emphasized that this funding aims to support citizens facing severe economic challenges. READ MORE  [ https://substack.com/redirect/d6d3cef7-1722-4fa7-a0f2-f9ee48777b08?j=eyJ1IjoiM2d5ZzliIn0.alnGDomjVT_QLyk6rHfohzJ76Mnc2-lH01FZb1ohFiM ]
Cross River State Opens Digital Hub to Help Youth Enterprises obtain CAC & SMEDAN Certificates, Boosting Access to N110 Billion NYIF Fund
The Cross River State Government, through the Office of the Special Adviser to the Governor on Digital Economy Development, has launched a digital hub to assist youths in obtaining Corporate Affairs Commission (CAC) and Small and Medium Enterprise Development Agency (SMEDAN) certificates, as well as creating business plans. READ MORE  [ https://substack.com/redirect/c0fc7396-b133-4e29-b305-37212619bd8a?j=eyJ1IjoiM2d5ZzliIn0.alnGDomjVT_QLyk6rHfohzJ76Mnc2-lH01FZb1ohFiM ]
GAIN to Convene Stakeholders to Boost Access to Nutritious Foods in Sub-Saharan Africa
The Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition (GAIN) is set to convene critical stakeholders from across the nutritious food supply chain in Sub-Saharan Africa at an event in Nigeria. This initiative aims to empower Enterprise Support Organisations (ESOs) to integrate effective nutrition strategies into their support for Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs). READ MORE [ https://substack.com/redirect/a3abae94-4bd8-4f8a-9b68-a49bfb5f4753?j=eyJ1IjoiM2d5ZzliIn0.alnGDomjVT_QLyk6rHfohzJ76Mnc2-lH01FZb1ohFiM ] 
Feature Articles 
Unlock Your Full Potential As Entrepreneurs: Change Your Neural Pathways by Rukayat Aramide Yusuf
As entrepreneurs, we’re constantly faced with challenges that test our resolve, creativity, and resilience. Do you know that your brain’s neural pathways can be reprogrammed to unlock new levels of success and well-being? Read The Article HERE [ https://substack.com/redirect/e1ae9301-f4c1-432b-ba77-8ca58954b2c1?j=eyJ1IjoiM2d5ZzliIn0.alnGDomjVT_QLyk6rHfohzJ76Mnc2-lH01FZb1ohFiM ] 
Your Production Cost Matters by Adegbamigbe Adewumi
If you are in agribusiness, do you know that there are a number of factors that can limit your profit? Let's talk about your production cost. Production cost talks about how much you spend in making or producing your products, many factors are put into consideration when calculating. Read Full Article HERE [ https://substack.com/redirect/677a4cb3-16bf-4a35-9514-90ad0cc9cd00?j=eyJ1IjoiM2d5ZzliIn0.alnGDomjVT_QLyk6rHfohzJ76Mnc2-lH01FZb1ohFiM ] to know why your production cost matters

Subject: YouTube Results in ONE Day
Message:
For serious YouTubers only  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 

Hey Enoch,

Imagine this: you upload a video to your YouTube channel and within a matter of days - it goes viral. Suddenly, your subscriber count is soaring , your engagement rates are through the roof , and opportunities you never dreamed of are knocking at your door  

This is every content creator's dream. And this isn't just a fantasy - it's a reality that many YouTubers have experienced. And with the right strategy, you can too.

There's a catch though. Going viral isn't always as "accidental" as you might think. It's usually the result of being 

****intentional****. Being 

****committed****. Being 

****consistent****.

It's common for creators to get discouraged when they aren't seeing the big view count that other channels are getting. 

And what do they do? They quit.

Here's where a lot of people fail: 

They give up way too soon. Remember, YouTube is 

**your** business.

**You owe it to yourself** to really see this thing through. Don't give up too soon.

How soon is too soon?

Before you've given it all you've got. 
Before you've applied all the principles you've learned. 
Before you've posted that golden video that gives your audience a solution to their problems.

If you improve on 

**just one thing** every time you make a new video, you're getting 1% better. 

Amazing things can happen with

**just one well-executed video**.

**You'd be surprised how much your life can also change in just ONE day**.

That's why I've put together this FREE comprehensive 1-day training session https://seancannell.acemlnb.com/lt.php?x=3DZy~GDDKaKa5sKuzw1MguFu~3Apjd-gwhhlYXnKJXib7pN-yEy.0ONt1HJzitDwjvYwbHLMInaa that's designed to help you 

**explode** on YouTube 

YouTube Growth Day https://seancannell.acemlnb.com/lt.php?x=3DZy~GDDKaKa5sKuzw1MguFu~3Apjd-gwhhlYXnKJXib7pN-yEy.0ONt1HJzitDwjvYwbHLMInaa is happening this 

**Saturday, August 10th from 8AM to about 3:30PM PT.** I'm going to give you the perfect video recipe so you can learn all you need to succeed in just 

**1 day** instead of weeks or months!

https://seancannell.acemlnb.com/lt.php?x=3DZy~GDDKaKa5sKuzw1MguFu~3Apjd-gwhhlYXnKJXib7pN-yEy.0ONt1HJzitDwjvYwbHLMInaa 

You owe it to yourself to make a move this summer, Enoch!

Jump in and sign up for Growth Day right here https://seancannell.acemlnb.com/lt.php?x=3DZy~GDDKaKa5sKuzw1MguFu~3Apjd-gwhhlYXnKJXib7pN-yEy.0ONt1HJzitDwjvYwbHLMInaa! 

Let's crush!

Subject: Enoch, if you feel stuck trying to pick a niche
Message:
ask yourself these questions  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 

Hey Enoch,

Imagine if you were to walk into an ice-cream shop and see them selling handbags. That'd be weird, right? 

What if you passed a perfume store and you saw a bicycle through the display window?

I know. 

**Weird**.

We've all seen a channel with random videos abouts cats, travel adventures, Keto recipes, and gaming. In my early days of YouTube, I was guilty of this same thing! I was all over the place!

"Weird" is one of the words that can come to peoples' minds when they browse through YouTube channels like that. It's confusing for them to see out-of-place videos that don't even remotely relate to each other in the same YouTube "storefront." 

Nothing catches their eye and they just move on to the next channel. You don't want that to be you.

You might argue that you're eclectic, creative, expressive, can't fit into a box, and your channel is a reflection of who you are. That may be true and the reason you started on YouTube is personal. 

BUT if you want to 

**really** grow and 

**consistently** bring in an income, you have to select a 

**NICHE**.

**Random videos will lead to random results.** You have to be known for something or you won't be remembered for anything at all.

"But Sean, I don't know which niche to choose. I'm passionate about so many things!" I hear you, Enoch.

You already have an idea about the first element you need to pick a niche: 

**PASSION**.

What gets you fired-up?
What could you talk about at 3am if someone woke you up out of deep sleep?
What never fails to catch your attention?

That is what you're passionate about. And passion is important because you have to be able to go through with this for the long haul even when things start to get demanding and even when you don't see any money (yet). 

https://seancannell.acemlnb.com/lt.php?x=3DZy~GDDKaKa5sKuzw1MguFu~3Apjd-gwhhlYXnKJXib7pN-yEy.0OJx2nFzidT2k_YwbHLHIXei 

The second ingredient you need to pick a niche and stick with it is 

**PROFICIENCY**. 

Do some introspection and ask yourself:

What am I naturally good at?
What have I been able to help someone else with?
What's something that I know a lot about through personal experience or formal education?

Don't worry. You don't necessarily have to be a board certified expert in this topic, you just have to be a few steps ahead of your target audience.

The last important element in picking a niche is 

**PROFIT**.

Once other people are interested in your niche, there's the possibility of making a profit.

Is it something you could eventually package and sell as a course?
Is anyone else with a similar niche making money from it?
Are there any well-established brands that have a product you could be an affiliate for?

You don't need a 

**ton** of views or subscribers to make money either. All you need are 1000 loyal fans.

Whatever overlaps all those 3 elements is the winning choice for you!

In this video https://seancannell.acemlnb.com/lt.php?x=3DZy~GDDKaKa5sKuzw1MguFu~3Apjd-gwhhlYXnKJXib7pN-yEy.0OJx2nFzidT2k_YwbHLHIXiZ you'll learn what the most profitable niches are in 2024. Check it out!

https://seancannell.acemlnb.com/lt.php?x=3DZy~GDDKaKa5sKuzw1MguFu~3Apjd-gwhhlYXnKJXib7pN-yEy.0OJx2nFzidT2k_YwbHLHIXiZ 

Click Here to Watch the Video https://seancannell.acemlnb.com/lt.php?x=3DZy~GDDKaKa5sKuzw1MguFu~3Apjd-gwhhlYXnKJXib7pN-yEy.0OJx2nFzidT2k_YwbHLHIXiZ

Keep crushing!
